article.question: I can't see my Pots in my FreeAgent/Xero Account

answer.answer:
You should be seeing the total balance of your account, including the balance that is held in Pots. Since Pots aren't actually a separate account they won't display in your FreeAgent/Xero account as such - that includes any movements in and out of Pots.

So, if you have £1,000 in your main Monzo account and £500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is £1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account.

However what you will see is your total balance of your account. So if you have £1,000 in your main Monzo account and £500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is £1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account.

relatedArticles.question: Connecting your Monzo account to Xero

answer.answer:
Here's how to connect your Monzo Business account to Xero:

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar of your Monzo app
2. Scroll down to 'Connect accounting tool'
3. Tap __Xero__

Transactions will sync every 24 hours after your first transaction settles. This means your bank feed could take a day or two to appear in Xero.

relatedArticles.question: Connecting your Monzo account to FreeAgent

answer.answer:
Here's how to connect your Monzo Business account to FreeAgent:

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar of your Monzo app
2. Scroll down to 'Connect accounting tool'
3. Tap __FreeAgent__

Transactions will sync every 24 hours after your first transaction settles. This means your bank feed could take a day or two to appear in FreeAgent.

relatedArticles.question: Connecting your Monzo account to QuickBooks

answer.answer:
Here's how to connect your Monzo Business account to QuickBooks:

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar of your Monzo app
2. Scroll down to 'Connect accounting tool'
3. Tap __QuickBooks__

Transactions will sync every 24 hours after your first transaction settles. This means your bank feed could take a day or two to appear in QuickBooks.

relatedArticles.question: I can't see my Pots in my FreeAgent/Xero Account

answer.answer:
You should be seeing the total balance of your account, including the balance that is held in Pots. Since Pots aren't actually a separate account they won't display in your FreeAgent/Xero account as such - that includes any movements in and out of Pots. 

So, if you have £1,000 in your main Monzo account and £500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is £1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account.

However what you will see is your total balance of your account. So if you have £1,000 in your main Monzo account and £500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is £1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account.

relatedArticles.question: My balance in my Monzo account and my FreeAgent/Xero account don't match up

answer.answer:
There are 2 reasons why this might be happening. 

1. Your transactions will sync with FreeAgent/Xero every 24 hours, therefore if you have made transactions in the last 24 hours these will have changed your balance in your Monzo account but will not have yet been reflected in your FreeAgent/Xero account. If you head over to your "Account" tab and scroll down to "Accounting Tools" you should be able to see when the last sync happened
2. Since Pots aren't actually a separate account they won't display in your FreeAgent/Xero account as such. However what you will see is your total balance of your account. So if you have £1,000 in your main Monzo account and £500 stashed away in a Pot, your total balance is £1,500 and this is the balance you will see in your FreeAgent/Xero account. 

If you think that your balance is still not right, and the above doesn't seem to explain the reason for us, you can contact us in the in app chat here.
